snippet: The United States attorney general should seize the opportunity to demonstrate his expressed respect for “constitutionally protected” news gathering.
abstract: Editorial calls on Atty Gen Eric Holder Jr to fulfill his pledge to uphold freedom of the press and call off prosecutors' quest to compel New York Times reporter James Risen to reveal a confidential source; holds Justice Department's stance is sharply at odds with case law and near-universal consensus, and with policy revisions that Holder himself proposed in July 2013.
lead_paragraph: The United States attorney general should seize the opportunity to demonstrate his expressed respect for “constitutionally protected” news gathering.
